definitions.definition: An area under the political control of another country and typically occupied by settlers (colonists) from it, or by their descendants.
examples: Much of the eastern United States was formerly a British colony ; other areas were French, Spanish, Dutch, or Swedish colonies .
Bermuda is a crown colony of Great Britain.

definitions.definition: A group of people who settle such an area and maintain ties to their native country, and (later) their descendants.
A group of people, of one nationality , ethnic group, or language , residing in a different country, city, or area; the area such people occupy.
examples: a colony of British expats in Spain
The Amana Colonies in Iowa were settled by people from Germany.

definitions.definition: A group of people with similar interests, occupations , or characteristics, living in a particular area; the area such people occupy.
examples: a nudist colony ;   the statue was put up right in the middle of the artist colony
a leper colony on the outskirts of town; most buildings in the penal colony were made of concrete

definitions.definition: A group of organisms of same or different species living together in close association.
examples: a colony of specialized polyps and medusoids

definitions.definition: A group of bacteria , fungi or other cells cultured together, especially from a single cell.

examples: Our colony is quite small, but each apartment is large.

definitions.definition: A local group of Beaver Scouts.
A potential new chapter of a fraternity or sorority awaiting official recognition from their headquarters .

main_definition: An area under the political control of another country and typically occupied by settlers (colonists) from it, or by their descendants.
secondary_definitions: A group of people who settle such an area and maintain ties to their native country, and (later) their descendants.
A group of people, of one nationality , ethnic group, or language , residing in a different country, city, or area; the area such people occupy.
A group of people with similar interests, occupations , or characteristics, living in a particular area; the area such people occupy.
( biology ) A group of organisms of same or different species living together in close association.
A group of bacteria , fungi or other cells cultured together, especially from a single cell.
( India ) An apartment complex or neighborhood .
A local group of Beaver Scouts.
A potential new chapter of a fraternity or sorority awaiting official recognition from their headquarters .
